junit.framework.Test
public class PlayerRobustnessTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Testcases with invalid arguments or Parameters to Player.play(URI, RTC[], Parameters).
Test also with invalid Player state.

Method Detail

test_2_2_1_1_Play_BadURI

public void test_2_2_1_1_Play_BadURI()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Test that a bad URI (does not exist) is properly handled by the Player.
  1. The URI does not exist

    2. Verify that error is MediaErr.NOT_FOUND.
    verify that qualifier is null
  2. The schema of the URI is not supported

    3. Verify that error is MediaErr.BAD_ARG.
    verify that qualifier is null

Requires testcase.promptfile, less that 20 seconds duration.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_1_2_Player_Invalid_Maxduration

public void test_2_2_1_2_Player_Invalid_Maxduration()
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
Check behavior when an invalid value for Player.MAX_DURATION is provided.

The implementation should revert to the default value (infinite) in this case.

  1. Play a file (that must be at least 5 seconds long) with MAX_DURATION set to -10 seconds
  2. Verify that the qualifier of the PlayerEvent is PlayerEvent.END_OF_PLAY_LIST, and the played duration is the full duration of the file.
  3. In the second run the Maxduration is set to double the file actual duration.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_1_3_Player_Invalid_StartOffset

public void test_2_2_1_3_Player_Invalid_StartOffset()
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
Check behavior as Player.START_OFFSET is set longer than the file maximum play duration.
The maximum duration of the file will be set as value of START_OFFSET
  1. Play a file with START_OFFSET = 50000, which is clearly greater than maximum duration of the file.
  2. Verify that the duration is very short (ideally zero).
  3. Verify that the qualifier of the PlayerEvent is PlayerEvent.END_OF_PLAY_LIST.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_1_4_Invalid_RepeatCount

public void test_2_2_1_4_Invalid_RepeatCount()
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Check behavior as Player.REPEAT_COUNT is set with invalid type (String) and value.
  1. Play a one-second file with REPEAT_COUNT = -10 or REPEAT_COUNT="one"
  2. Verify the actual Duration is 1 second, the file is played 1 time which is the default value.
  3. verify that the qualifier of the PlayerEvent is PlayerEvent.END_OF_PLAY_LIST.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_1_5_Invalid_Interval

public void test_2_2_1_5_Invalid_Interval()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Check behavior when Player.INTERVAL is set with an invalid value.
Play a one-second file with REPEAT_COUNT = 2, and INTERVAL = -3s.
Verify that the play duration is 2 seconds, since the default value for INTERVAL is zero.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_1_6_Player_State

public void test_2_2_1_6_Player_State()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Verify that the Player sends a PlayerEvent only when appropriate.

The Player starts a play action and is stopped while the file is playing by invoking stop() method. The state of the Player should change to idle. After that a second play action is started, the file is played to completion and player received an EOD response. The stop() method is called again as the player is in idle state, no response/event should occur this time.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
